meanings.definition: The quality or state of being imperishable.
meanings.sent1: The imperishability of the ancient artifact amazed the historians.
meanings.sent2: The imperishability of plastic makes it a popular choice for packaging.
meanings.sent3: The imperishability of the cake left out in the rain was a mystery to the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like the imperishability of a diamond, enduring and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The imperishability of the mountain stood as a symbol of strength and resilience.

meanings.definition: The condition of being unable to perish or decay.
meanings.sent1: The imperishability of the metal made it ideal for outdoor sculptures.
meanings.sent2: The imperishability of the seeds ensured a bountiful harvest year after year.
meanings.sent3: The imperishability of the leftovers in the fridge surprised the forgetful chef.
meanings.sent4: The imperishability of her memory in his heart was a comfort in times of loneliness.
meanings.sent5: The imperishability of the ancient ruins spoke of a civilization long gone but not forgotten.
